header.title: Quick Guide to Practical Magick: How to create a practical and results oriented ritual quickly and simply

central_thesis: The document provides a brief and simple guide to creating practical, results-oriented magical rituals based on a psychological model, where all magical work originates from the practitioner's Self, without reliance on external gods or beings.

structure_content.chapter_title: Step One: The Statement of Intent
structure_content.summary: This step outlines the creation of a clear and concise Statement of Intent, emphasizing precision to increase success probability while warning against excessive complication or vagueness, both of which can hinder desired outcomes or lead to undesirable results.

structure_content.chapter_title: Step Two: Sigilization of the Statement of Intent
structure_content.summary: This section introduces Sigilization as a technique to bypass conscious self-sabotaging desires. It describes two types: Pictograph Sigils (abstract symbols) and Mantra Sigils (nonsense words/sentences), both designed to convey the Statement of Intent to the subconscious without conscious recognition.

Elaborates on the creation of both Pictograph and Mantra Sigils. A Pictograph Sigil is formed by simplifying a visual representation of the intent into an abstract symbol. A Mantra Sigil is created by removing repeated letters from the Statement of Intent and forming nonsense words.

structure_content.chapter_title: Step Three: Setting the Mood with an Opening Rite
structure_content.summary: Explains the role of a Banishing Rite in Chaos Magick, not as protection from external entities, but as a mechanism to focus gnosis and energy, acting as 'terminals of a battery' for the ritual. It describes a general banishing process.

A specific, step-by-step banishing ritual designed for Left Hand Path workings, involving drawing a sphere, ringing a bell, directional invocations of specific entities (Satan, Lucifer, Belial, Leviathan), invoking Set, meditation for gnosis, and concluding with laughter.

structure_content.chapter_title: Step Four: Invocation or Evocation of a deity
structure_content.summary: Defines Invocation (calling a spirit into oneself for self-transformation) and Evocation (summoning a spirit externally for external change) within the psychological model. It emphasizes that 'god forms' are symbols of human consciousness and can be traditional or custom-created, providing guidance for intense focus in both practices.

Explains Gnosis as a Magickal Trance state crucial for embedding the Sigil into the subconscious. It details two types: Inhibitory Gnosis (silencing the mind through methods like meditation) and Excitatory Gnosis (overstimulating the mind through methods like orgasm, dancing, or stimulants).
Instructs the practitioner to repeat the banishing from Step Three, concluding the ritual with the statement 'So it is Done!' to affirm the power of their own Will in manifesting the magical outcome.

key_concepts.definition: A form of Magick focused on achieving tangible, 'result oriented' outcomes such as wealth, relationships, or revenge, as opposed to spiritual enlightenment or abstract goals.
The philosophical underpinning that states there are no external gods or beings assisting in the Magick ritual, and all magical work originates from the practitioner's own Self and subconscious mind.
A precise and simple declaration of the desired outcome of a ritual, critical for focusing magical energy and preventing undesired results or over-complication.

A Magickal technique used to bypass the conscious mind's 'secret desire for failure' by encoding the Statement of Intent into a symbol or sound, which is then forgotten by the conscious mind but recognized by the subconscious.

A type of Sigil created by constructing a symbol using elements that represent the Statement of Intent, yet is abstract enough not to directly resemble the original concept, aiding in conscious forgetting.
A type of Sigil in the form of a word or sentence made of nonsense sounds, created from the Statement of Intent by removing repeated letters and rearranging the remainder.

In Chaos Magick, a ritual performed before and after magical workings, serving not as protection from external forces, but as 'terminals of a battery' to focus the gnosis and power of the ritual towards the desired end.
The act of calling forth a spirit or 'god form' into one's own body, primarily used for self-transformation or causing self-change by adopting the characteristics of the invoked entity.
The act of summoning a spirit or 'god form' externally to the Magickian, typically used for external changes or to make requests to the entity.
The state of Magickal Trance, crucial for activating the Sigil and embedding it into the subconscious mind to fulfill its purpose. It can be achieved through inhibitory or excitatory methods.
A philosophical and magical orientation emphasizing individual will, self-deification, and autonomy, often involving practices that challenge conventional norms or external authorities.

practical_system.description: The text presents a six-step operative system for creating and executing a 'Result Oriented Ritual' within a psychological model of Magick. The system emphasizes internal mechanisms for manifesting desired outcomes, bypassing conscious self-sabotage, and leveraging altered states of consciousness (Gnosis) to impress the magical intent upon the subconscious.
tools: Pen and paper (for Statement of Intent and Sigil creation)
Practitioner's hand or a magical weapon (for drawing symbols in the air during banishing)
Incense, food, drink (as optional offerings for Evocation)
Designated object or space (for Evocation focus)
The practitioner's own mind and body (for visualization, emotional states, sensory manipulation for Gnosis)
rituals: Formulating a precise and simple Statement of Intent.
Creating a Sigil (Pictograph or Mantra) from the Statement of Intent and consciously forgetting it.
Performing an Opening Rite/Banishing (general principles or the specific Left Hand Path Banishing) to focus energy.
Choosing between Invocation (for self-change) or Evocation (for external change) of a deity/god form, understanding them as symbolic representations of consciousness.
Entering a state of Gnosis (Inhibitory or Excitatory) to activate and embed the Sigil into the subconscious.
Performing a Closing Rite/Banishing, followed by the declaration 'So it is Done!' to affirm the practitioner's Will.

relevant_quotes.text: What follows is a brief and simple guide to Practical Magick and the steps involved in creating a Result Oriented Ritual – that is a ritual focus on getting laid, getting rich, or getting even. The material that follows is presented under the psychological model of Magick – that there are no external gods or beings assisting in the Magick ritual, that the work being done arises from the Self.
Excessive complication reduces the probability of success for the working.
To get around the secret desire for failure we can trick our own mind into forgetting the Statement of Intent, using a Magick technique called Sigilization.

Chaos Magickians, naturally, do not fear the god forms, demons and spirits that they call forth so the use of banishing as a form of protection from the beings evoked during ritual is unnecessary for Chaos Magickians.
Gnosis is the state of Magickal Trance.
We use the words 'So it is Done!' to represent the fact that it is our own Will that is performing the Magick – not the Will of God or some ghost in the sky, but our own power.

critical_analysis.relevance: This guide is highly relevant within the modern Western Esoteric tradition, particularly for Chaos Magick practitioners. It offers a clear, pragmatic framework for ritual construction, demystifying complex magical components by recontextualizing them within a psychological model. Its emphasis on self-will and internal processes aligns with contemporary, non-dogmatic approaches to magic, making it a valuable entry point for those seeking results-oriented spellcraft.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes beginners and intermediate practitioners of Chaos Magick, secular magic, or anyone interested in a psychological and results-focused approach to ritual. Its step-by-step nature and direct language make it accessible, while the inclusion of a Left Hand Path banishing suggests an appeal to those exploring themes of self-empowerment and challenging traditional paradigms.
